bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Bernhard J. Stern (1894-1956) was a social scientist and political radical who came under persecution from Congressional investigative committees during the McCarthy period. The materials in the collection were assembled by Samuel W. Bloom, a sociology professor who wrote an article on Stern, "The Intellectual in a Time of Crisis," for Volume 26 of the Journal of the History of the Behavioral Sciences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The documents pertain to Bloom's writing of the article and contains drafts of the article, correspondence related to it, and much of the documentation and research used in its writing.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions

Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which s/he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Jon Bloom.
